alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:22PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Shelby County through 315 PM CDT... At 222 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Westover to near Columbiana. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Calera, Chelsea, Columbiana, Wilsonville, Harpersville, Westover, Shelby, Beeswax Creek Park and Highway 145 and CR 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
